common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Processing Errors and UI Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot encountering processing errors, displaying 'Something went wrong' messages.  This might be related to OpenAI API keys, SSL certificates, or specific LLMs. Suggested solutions include removing API keys, switching to GPT4o, reinstalling software, or updating to the latest version. Additionally, users experience UI issues like oversized fonts and zoom functionalities not working properly, with the Pieces team actively working on solutions.

related_issues.title: The interface's font is too large.
related_issues.text:
The interface's font is too large.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The recent interface update, specifically the increased font size in the answer section, limits the number of answers that can be displayed. 
![Screenshot from 2024-07-12 22-14-57](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3265af50-ffc6-4ab1-b6b8-397cd3979a9f)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User `ksubramanyeshwara` reported two issues:
    * Font size increased after update in the Pieces Copilot app.
    * Unable to zoom in/out during onboarding screens.
* The team acknowledged the font size issue and mentioned ongoing UI adjustments.
* User `choir241` provided steps to reproduce the zoom issue and suggested a solution.
* User `hra42` reported a similar issue with the chat window zoom.
* The team released version 3.1.0 of the Desktop App with a fix for the zoom issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Increased font size in the Pieces Copilot app post-update.
* Inability to zoom in/out during onboarding screens.
* Inability to zoom in/out on the chat window.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The team is working on UI adjustments for the font size issue.
* Zooming in/out during onboarding screens was fixed in version 3.1.0 of the Desktop App.
* No clear solution mentioned for the chat window zoom issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Font size issue is being addressed through UI adjustments.
* Zoom issue in onboarding screens is resolved in version 3.1.0.
* Chat window zoom issue still persists.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation spans from July 2024 to January 2025.
* Some users reported experiencing the issue on specific screen resolutions and OS versions.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @gittydia reported an issue with Pieces Copilot Service.
* The issue was related to the "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing..." error message.
* @luigigalli confirmed the same issue on macOS with the latest PiecesOS version.

**Problems Identified:**

* The "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing..." error message was occurring for multiple users.
* The issue persisted even after the supposed fix in PiecesOS 11.0.4.
* The issue occurred with different LLMs (Claude Sonnet, ChatGPT, Gemini).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Upgrade to PiecesOS 11.0.4.
* Uninstall the 11.0.19-staging build for POS and install the latest from Production 11.0.4.
* Real-time debugging via a scheduled call.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved for @luigigalli.
* A real-time debugging session is scheduled to further investigate the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The bot initially suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces provided support and troubleshooting steps.
* Staging builds are not recommended due to potential instability.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues with processing requests, receiving error messages like "Something went wrong with processing."
* The issue seems to be related to OpenAI API keys and local SSL certificates.
* The proposed solutions include removing the OpenAI API key, switching to the GPT4o model, and reinstalling the Pieces software.

**Problems Identified:**

* OpenAI API keys are causing processing failures in some cases.
* There may be issues with local SSL certificates.
* Claude and Gemini language models might be experiencing problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the OpenAI API key.
* Switch to the GPT4o language model.
* Update to Pieces version 11.0.3.
* Sign in to Pieces to increase rate limit.
* Uninstall and reinstall Pieces for Developers and PiecesOS.
* Ensure Windows Defender is not blocking Pieces requests.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The cause of the issue is still under investigation.
* Some users have reported success after removing their OpenAI API key.
* It is recommended to switch to the GPT4o model for now.
* If the issues persist, users can contact the developer for real-time debugging.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Processing Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot failing to process requests, displaying error messages. This issue appears across operating systems and Pieces versions. Suggested solutions include checking OpenAI API keys, switching to GPT4o model, ensuring Pieces isn't blocked by firewalls, and reinstalling Pieces software.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Conversation Summary for Pieces Support GitHub Issue: 

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@ThemePark) reports an inability to open the Pieces Desktop App.

**Problems Identified:**

* App fails to launch after latest Pieces OS 11.0 update.
* This appears to be an ongoing issue with multiple users experiencing similar problems (as evidenced by linked references).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support bot recommends checking related issues and resources. 
* @mack-at-pieces requests additional information: Windows version and PiecesOS/Desktop installation confirmation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No further updates provided. Issue remains open, awaiting user response and troubleshooting. 

**Additional Notes:**

* User is encouraged to share additional details for better diagnosis and resolution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report connection errors with Pieces OS after updating to version 11.0.4.  These errors manifest as 'Connection refused' messages when attempting to connect to the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000 or 127.0.0.1:39300) and difficulties downloading local LLMs.  Suggested solutions include verifying the Pieces OS is running and the correct port is being used.  Further investigation and support logs may be required for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with Pieces not working after upgrading to version 11.0.0.
* The issue seems to be related to the new port 39300 used by PiecesOS.
* Screenshots were provided showing the error message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces is not working after upgrading to version 11.0.0.
* The new port 39300 might be causing the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested trying the new port 39300.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists even after trying the new port. 
* Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and find a solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user provided screenshots as evidence of the issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team. 
* The user was directed to relevant resources for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## GitHub Issue Summary: Unable to Download Local LLMs

**Key Points:**

- User (@AmanSingh766) reported encountering an error when trying to download local LLMs.
- The error message: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress"
- Pieces support bot provided links to similar 
issues and resource links.
- @mark-at-pieces investigated further, asking for 
support logs and clarifying error occurrence frequency.

**Problems:**

- User experiences error while downloading local LLMs.
- The specific cause of the error message remains unclear.

**Solutions:**

- Pieces support team requested support logs and information 
about error consistency for further diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue remains ongoing, pending user response and further
 investigation by Pieces support. 

**Note:** The conversation provides limited 
information for an conclusive diagnosis. More 
interactions are vital for understanding the root cause.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and App Installation and Processing Errors
common_issues.description: Users report installation failures of Pieces OS and app on Linux and Windows due to missing dependencies, sandbox restrictions, and Windows Defender blocks. Processing errors with messages like 'Something went wrong with processing' are also prevalent, potentially linked to OpenAI API keys and SSL certificates. Proposed solutions include dependency installation, software updates, Windows Defender configuration, and switching to alternative language models.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation failure in Pieces OS
* Missing `curl` dependency in Pieces OS snap
* Inability to launch external executables from Pieces OS sandbox

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS attempts to install Ollama using `curl`, which is not guaranteed to be installed.
* Pieces OS snap confinement prevents access to external executables like Ollama.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patching Pieces OS to allow Ollama usage within the sandbox.
* Adding `curl` to the Pieces OS snap dependency packages.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix is in development and expected to be released in the upcoming week.
* Issue remains unresolved in the latest Pieces OS snap version as of January 23, 2025.

related_issues.title: suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
related_issues.text:
suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

n/a

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)

```
  shane @ moa ❯ ~ cd .\Downloads\
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
ResourceUnavailable: Program 'Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' failed to run: An error occurred trying to start process 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads\Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' with working directory 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads'. The app didn't start.At line:1 char:1
+ ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads
```


also tried double clicking in gui. same issue>

I also tried as user and admin

all failed
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces App Installation Issue

**Key Points:**

* Pieces App installation using App Installer fails on Windows.
* Exe installer works, but encounters issues launching.
* Windows Defender blocks app execution.

**Problems Identified:**

* App Installer installation fails.
* Launcher fails to start after successful installation.
* Windows Defender blocks the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer and Microsoft Store.
* Restart PC after updates.
* Add exclusion for Pieces App directory in Windows Defender.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* App installation using exe installer succeeds.
* Cause of Windows Defender blocking is unclear.
* Further investigation and documentation update planned for February 2025.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Windows App Errors
common_issues.description: Users report errors with the Pieces OS Windows app, including a non-dismissable overlay message, connection refused errors, and issues after upgrading to version 11.0.0. Suggested solutions include allowing access to Pieces Qdrant Server, checking Pieces OS and Desktop App installation, and ensuring the correct port (39300) is being used.

related_issues.title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
related_issues.text:
ANNOUNCEMENT: Pieces Qdrant Server pop up in Pieces OS 8.0.0 Windows
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

8.0.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Windows users please be aware that with the release of Pieces OS v8.0.0, upon loading the desktop application the first time you may receive the following dialog box:

![image (8)](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/152189388/bd326c95-752d-435f-88d2-9da46d88c46a)

This is a standalone executable that we need to run in order to enable our new long-term memory and other enhancements to the copilot chat experience. This dialog box is expected and in order to receive this new functionality you will need to choose "Allow access." If you deny it, you will likely have a degraded chat experience and it may cause breakages in the app down the line. 

Apologies for the inconvenience; we will work on making this a better user experience going forward.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* This issue is requesting documentation on installing certain software for Windows.
* The documentation is intended for PiecesOS.

**Problems Identified:**

* The original documentation request predates the deprecation of the relevant software (qdrant).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Documenting the requested software is no longer necessary due to its deprecation.
* The issue will be closed once the new PiecesOS documentation is finalized.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open, but is awaiting closure upon completion of the new documentation.
* Documentation specific to the requested software is no longer required.

recommendations: "Investigate and address the root cause of Pieces Copilot processing errors, including OpenAI API key issues, SSL certificate problems, and potential conflicts with firewalls or antivirus software."
